summary.long: Colossians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the saints and faithful brethren in Christ who are at Colosse: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the charity which ye have toward all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens, of which ye have already heard by the word of the truth of the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is come unto you, as it is in all the world, and brings forth fruit, as it does also in you, since the day ye heard it and knew the grace of God in truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as ye also learned of Epaphras, our dear fellowservant, who is for you a faithful minister of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also declared unto us your charity in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, asking that ye might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye might walk worthy of the Lord, pleasing him in everything, being fruitful in every good work, and growing in the knowledge of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: strengthened with all might, according to the power of his glory unto all patience and longsuffering with joyfulness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks unto the Father, who has made us worthy to participate in the inheritance of the saints in light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has delivered us from the power of darkness, and has translated us into the kingdom of his dear Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have redemption through his blood, even the remission of sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for by him were all things created, that are in the heavens and that are in earth, visible and invisible, whether they are thrones or dominions or principalities or powers: all things were created by him and in him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he is before all things, and by him all things consist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he is the head of the body, the congregation, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in all things he might have the preeminence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it pleased the Father that in him should all fullness dwell
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by him to reconcile all things unto himself, having made peace through the blood of his cross, {Gr. stauro – stake} whether they are the things in the earth or the things in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, that were in another time alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now he has reconciled you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if ye continue in the faith grounded and settled and are not moved away from the hope of the gospel, which ye have heard and which is preached to every creature which is under heaven, of which I Paul am made a minister,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who now rejoice in my sufferings for you and fulfill in my flesh that which is lacking of the tribulations of the Christ for his body’s sake, which is the congregation, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of which I am made a minister by the dispensation of God which is given to me in you, to fulfil the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even the mystery which has been hid from ages and from generations, but now is made manifest to his saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom God would make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery in the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom we preach, warning every man and teaching in all wisdom that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which I continue to labour, contending according to his operation, which he works in me mightily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I would that ye knew what great conflict I have for you and for those at Laodicea and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that their hearts might be comforted, being knit together in charity and in all the riches of the fulfilled understanding to know the mystery of the God and Father and of the Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this I say lest anyone should beguile you with enticing words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though I am absent in the flesh, yet I am with you in the spirit, joying and beholding your order and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore in the manner in which ye received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk ye in him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rooted and built up in him and confirmed in the faith, as ye have been taught, abounding therein with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the traditions of men, according to the elements of the world, and not after Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in him dwells all the fullness of the Godhead bodily,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye are complete in him, who is the head of all principality and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In whom also ye are circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, in putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of the Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: buried together with him in baptism, wherein also ye are risen with him through the faith of the operation of God, who has raised him from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, being dead in sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, he has quickened together with him, having forgiven you all trespasses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blotting out the bill of the decrees that was against us, which was contrary to us and took it out of the way, nailing it to his cross, {Gr. stauro – stake}
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having spoiled the principalities and the powers, he made a show of them openly, triumphing over them in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one therefore judge you in food or in drink or in respect of a feast day or of the new moon or of the sabbath days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which are a shadow of things to come, but the body is of the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one govern you according to their own will under pretext of humility and religion of angels, intruding into those things which they have not seen, vainly puffed up by their fleshly mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not holding fast to the Head, from whom all the body, fed and united by its joints and bonds, grows in the increase of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if ye are dead with the Christ to the elements of the world, why, as though living unto the world, do ye decree rites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: touch not; taste not; handle not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which all perish with the using, because they are the commandments and doctrines of men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which things have indeed a show of wisdom in will worship and humility and neglecting of the body, but they have absolutely no value against the appetites of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye then are risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where the Christ sits at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set your sight on things above, not on things on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye are dead and your life is hid with the Christ in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Christ, who is our life, shall be manifested, then shall ye also be manifested with him in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth: fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil lust, and covetousness, which is idolatry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which things’ sake the wrath of God comes on the sons of disobedience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which ye also walked some time, when ye lived in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now put ye also off all these things: anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lie not one to another, putting off the old man with his deeds
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and being clothed with the new man, who is renewed in knowledge according to the image of the one that created him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian nor Scythian, slave nor free: but Christ is all and in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Clothed, therefore, (as the elect of God, holy and beloved) with bowels of mercies, with kindness, with humility, with meekness, with tolerance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: forbearing one another and forgiving one another if anyone has a quarrel against another: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And above all these things put on charity, which is the bond of perfection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, into which likewise ye are called into one body, and be ye thankful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the word of the Christ dwell in you in abundance in all wisdom, teaching you and exhorting you one to another with psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, with grace singing in your hearts unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever ye do whether in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to the God and Father by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, be subject to your own husbands as it is fit in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives and do not be bitter against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers, provoke not your children lest they become disheartened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves, in all things hearken unto your masters according to the flesh, not serving to be seen as those who only please men, but in simplicity of heart, fearing God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance, for ye serve the Lord Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that does wrong shall receive the wrong which he has done, now that there is no respect of persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Masters, do that which is just and right with your slaves, knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Persevere in prayer and watch in the same with thanksgiving,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praying also together for us that God would open unto us the door of the word, to speak the mystery of the Christ, for which I am also in bonds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Walk in wisdom towards outsiders, winning the occasion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your word be always with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer each one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All my affairs shall Tychicus declare unto you, who is a beloved brother and a faithful servant and fellow slave in the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know your affairs and comfort your hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They shall make known unto you all the things which are happening here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aristarchus, my fellowprisoner, salutes you, and Mark, nephew to Barnabas, (concerning whom ye have received commandments, if he comes unto you, receive him),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus, who is called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These only are my fellowworkers unto the kingdom of God, who have been a comfort unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, who is one of you, a slave of Christ, salutes you, always labouring fervently for you in prayers, that ye may stand firm, perfect and fulfilled in all the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I bear witness of him, that he has a great zeal for you and those that are in Laodicea and those in Hierapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas, greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salute the brethren who are in Laodicea and Nymphas and the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} which is in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when this epistle is read among you, cause that it be read also in the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of the Laodiceans, and that ye likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to Archippus, Take heed to fulfil the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
